comment: Syrupy.  Chewy finish, toasted grain, crushed mint, cloves. Very autumnal
Busters cask strength version. Hot but fairly smooth.

Got this for Christmas. Never heard of it before, it was highly recommended by the guy in the bourbon section of Total Wine. 
I have to say for being a high rye (36%) it's exceptionally smooth. There is a forward bite being 99 proof, but quickly smooths out to a sweet tingling finish. After opening up it has a bubble gum/cotton candy scent to the nose. But the flavor is never that sweet. It's a perfect mix of tingle to smooth transition as it goes down. Highly recommend you give this one a try.

Purchased three bottles of barrel strength, 56.4% ABV, private selection through Appalachian Whiskey Society in winter of 2014 For approximately $30 per bottle.  Gave one bottle to Chris Doddrill and a half a bottle to Mike Massinople. last tasting with Dodrill in spring of 2014.
Old scout and contradiction by old scout
Smells of lots of spices and a little sweetness. Smooth, full, and rich. Spice, caramel and a little leather. Finish is light spice and warm burn.

Rye spice is prominent. Seems hotter than other 100 proof bourbons I've had. Dry finish. A few drops of water tamed it but it was still dry and spicy. Nothing wrong with it though. It's just not for fans of sweet, easy-drinking whiskeys.
Really good, smooth. Nothing harsh. Interested to see what this distiller does once they are more locally sourcing and producing.
A little muted and light on the back of the tongue. Doesn't have enough balance for my taste. Not bad by any means just not amazing.
Easy drinking, smooth and sweet. This is the 10 year  single barrel from San Francisco Wine Trading Company.
For the past year this has been my go-to whiskey. A little spicier than sweet, but not overwhelming.
Great caramel flavors and very smooth. Easy to sip. Love it.
One of my favourite bourbons, a full round intense nose and mouthful, delicious long finish

NOSE: Lots of vanilla, little bit of date or plum maybe, and some cinnamon. A little strong on the alcohol for the proof. Nice, not overly complex.  PALATE: Classic bourbon flavors, sweet, caramel and vanilla, nice cinnamon notes a little stronger than they were on the nose. Somewhat thin mouthfeel. Mellow nicely, the strong alcohol on the nose does not make the palate, which is good.  FINISH: smooth, ever so slightly smoky, more cinnamon and spice, slightly peppery.  THOUGHTS: Nothing too complicated here, but a very nice pour. Enjoyable, am not going to kill myself to find the 7 year anywhere I can, interested in the 10 year and when they start distilling their own.
Sweet nose...maybe apricot and some vanilla quick spicy hot black pepper dry finish. Black pepper finish lingers. Nice one

7 Year/Batch #153 / Bottled 2016/11/24
Nose - Initially you get a bit of a hot whiff, but with a bit of time you get classic notes of vanilla and brown sugar. This transitions to dark juicy cherries and what seems like strawberry shortcake or those individualy wrapped strawberry hard candies. I get an almost oily/buttery-like nose too.
Taste - Nose transitions into an oily sweet vanilla, cherries, and strawberries. There's this odd slightly raw ethanol note I get in this one though. It's like if you took dark cherries, strawberries, and sauteed it in butter and brown sugar with a vanilla pod, and then instead of using a quality rum or brandy to flambe, you used a bit of everclear.
Finish - Sweetness slowly fades to a young oakiness, vanilla and cherries linger and then again I get a bitterness like that of crushed cherry pits. Leaves a lightly drying, yet oily mouthfeel.
81/100
Very smooth, full of flavor. Very pleasant nose, with a little bite up front.
Cherries and spice on the nose. Spicy, sweet, and smooth.

Full sweet 
Kick at the end.
Sweet rye spice on the nose. Spicy and straightforward. Bourbon without alot going on other than alot of spice, short vanilla burst finish.
Not bad for the price.  Gave an extra star due to the price point.
Soft sweet oak in nice way .Cinnamon  vanilla caramel. Taste burn tingle, finish smooth  flat like bourbon should be not much of complexity ..

Strong nose with honey and some citrus. Maybe a little vanilla as well. A sweeter aroma. Pleasant on the nose. 

Neat it hits the tip of the tongue and lingers on the sides as well. Warming. No burn going down. Flavor seems to fade faster than I would like. Solid taste but not extremely memorable.  Some of that sweetness hits the room of the mouth.

Flavor intensifies over ice. My preferred way to drink this particular bourbon.

Super smooth
Cherry, sweet 
Very solid!

[LOOK] Classic bourbon coloring [NOSE] Werther's Originals, caramel, brioche French toast, bales of dried alfalfa, sugarcane, cold oatmeal, honey Dijon mustard, burnt candied pecans, wisps of juicy overripe berries [PALATE] Honey, minerals, plum skin, brown sugar, warm biscuits from scratch, very Maillard-y, whole grain rye proteins and unmodified starch flavors lurk [FINISH] Long, grainy, rye spice, sweet then dry [MOUTHFEEL] Rather fun, spicy, but not distractingly spicy

*Batch 117-Bottled by James on 3/12/15-Aged 7yrs* This had been on my "to try" list for a while and after I received an email from Smooth Ambler saying this and the 10 year were being discontinued due to procurement issues I decided to pick up one of the last two bottles my store had. This one is a light amber moving toward rust. Appropriate for 7 yrs and 99 proof. On the nose, give it a few minutes to open up for a touch of confectionary sweetness (think a custard filled donut) with a hefty dose of rye spice and faint oak. Similar to Wild Turkey. Oddly a splash of water brings a big dose of ethanol to the nose. Tried neat, this one starts off with a promising pink bubblegum sweetness, but that is quickly shoved out of the way by aggressive hot rye spice and bitter oak. Goes down with a short hot finish with tingling astringency left on the palate. A splash does tame the aggressiveness of this somewhat, but not nearly enough. Ice just makes it a muddled mess. Did not mix well either. I am usually a fan of high rye bourbons, but this one has no balance.
Loved it, nice and hot, a little harsh is a good thing.
Apple pie nose, sweet but a little one note

I am happy I tried this. Decent pour with a little bit for everyone. Sweet and a touch of the burn, but not too much of either. I would buy this again. I would say the description on this app is spot on, but I did not need water or ice. Well worth the 29.99 sale price. 3.3/5
Batch 179, 5/4/16. Interesting nose, sweet and herbal, minty maybe. Interesting palate as well. Earthy, herbal. but also sweet. Deep flavors. Mint lingers on the tongue. Medium finish. 5/27/18
Smooth, soft sent. Touch too sweet for my preference.
I think this is much smoother the review gives it credit for. I did not taste the rye that much, more corn sweetness and went down easy neat, no ice.
Sugar House pick. Darn tasty, but a little hot, so I added a cube. Caramel, biscuits, and sweet honey. 3.75
Batch no. 158, bottled on 1/6/16 by Andrew
Tastes like brown-sugar glazed bourbon? Great in small quantities, probably too sweet for a full glass

nose is a classic American vanilla forward bourbon but the finish reminds me of almost an Islay Scotch with subtle Briney almost earthy charcoal finish. Minty, dry and a touch hot but the finish is quick doesn't linger. lightly tanic.

I generally thought this was decent bourbon.  It has grassy and spicy notes on the mouth because of the rye.  Those were the most prominent notes for me.  Slight sweetness on the nose, a bit of ethanol as well.
Middle of the line not great not bad

A solid Bourbon. Initial nose is chard oak and corn. Pallet starts off hot and spicy but smooths out quickly and offers more flavors of vanilla and baking spice. Finish leaves that great warm all over feeling.
agree with the hot finish but I can enjoy this on ice for sure
Pretty smooth. Just a tiny bit hot/spicy.
Not much to write home about. Never really developed beyond the soft caramel and spiced nose. Finish was sort of hot but add some water and it becomes bearable.

49.5% 7 Year MGP

Nose- Maple syrup; rye spice; caramel; almonds, dried cherries 

Palate- Caramel; Rich vanilla; almonds; dried apricots; spicy oak

Finish- Medium/long, oily finish; Rye spices; Gingerbread; aged oak


Great pour. Not overly complex, but balanced and very tasty. The nose has great aromas of almonds and rye spices (traditional MGP notes). The palate isn’t anything crazy, but I get tons of vanilla, aged oak, and dried fruits. My favorite part of this is the gingerbread spice I get on the finish, just lovely.

Nose:  very subtle.  Honestly, not a lot there. Does not excite the tastebuds for what’s a lot to come. 

Palate: earthy - rye influence is dominant.  I leather and a hint of plug tobacco.  A bit thin, but it works for this one.  Not great overall at this point. 

Finish: strangely, this bourbon finishes strong. Mix “hug” lingers for a but along with leathery, chocolate tones.  Makes me want a nice cigar.  

Overall, a little disappointed.  I had high hopes for this bourbon based on my research.  It didn’t live up to expectations, but still has a place on my bar.  Will pair very well with a nice fat cigar.
